name: The Song Download
tagline: Download for The Song if a contribution has been made to a bitcoin address.
body:
### Welcome to Dash's Song download page.
The song is downloadable as part of a choose-your-price model using Bitcoins. 

If you haven't heard of Bitcoin, please visit [Bitcoin.org](https://bitcoin.org/). It is a modern currency built on the principles of security and openness. To get the song, you'l need to register for a wallet and buy some bitcoins.
1. Choose a wallet (the best source is information is [Bitcoin.org's wallet choosing page](https://bitcoin.org/en/choose-your-wallet).
2. Buy some bitcoins ([this](http://howtobuybitcoins.info/) is a good place to find out how)
Now that's done, you can use your bitcoins at many online and some real-world merchants! See [this page](http://www.wheretospendbitcoins.co.uk/) for the UK, or try [this search](https://google.com/search?q=where+to+buy+bitcoins).

To get the song, follow these simple steps:
1. Using your bitcoin wallet, create a transaction to this address:
`1PZ5ebvdt43dvRRgRNgBhsq2PwAKN4X6W`
![RNLI Bitcoin Address QR Code](https://rnli.org/howtosupportus/donatenow/Documents/RNLI-BitcoinWallet-QR.jpg)
2. Enter your bitcoin address here:
<input type="text" name="DonatorAdress" value="" placeholder="Your address">


### Authors and Contributors
You can @mention a GitHub username to generate a link to their profile. The resulting `<a>` element will link to the contributor's GitHub Profile. For example: In 2007, Chris Wanstrath (@defunkt), PJ Hyett (@pjhyett), and Tom Preston-Werner (@mojombo) founded GitHub.

### 3rd Part Contributions
Made using https://github.com/LUXSTACK/razrbit-sdk-javascript
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
